text: {| |} Zophar Mills was a fireboat operated by the Fire Department of New York City from 1883 to 1958. She was the department's first iron-hulled vessel and had a pumping capacity of per minute. According to some accounts, she was the first fireboat called to the burning of , where over a thousand people lost their lives. Other accounts say was the first fireboat to be dispatched. ==See also== * Fireboats in New York City == References == Category:Fireboats of New York City Category:1883 ships
title: Zophar Mills
